page.title: 12DONCASTER'S MANSION HOUSE
page.content: THE MANSION HOUSE IS OF IMPOSING APPEARANCE STANDING IN THE MIDDLE OF DONCASTER'S HIGH STREET.ITS HISTORY AND ARCHITECTURE ARE NOT EQUALLED IN THE TOWN AND,LIKE ITS COUNTERPARTS IN LONDON AND YORK,IT IS A CENTRE OF CIVIC BUSINESS. IN NOVEMBER 1738 THE CORPORATION AGREED TO BUILD A MANSION HOUSE FOR THE MAYOR.BY 1801 THE STONE FRONT HAD WEATHERED BADLY AND HAD TO BE REPAIRED.BY 1806 THE NEW DINING ROOM,60 FEET LONG AND 27 FEET WIDE WAS BUILT TO THE REAR OF THE BUILDING.IN 1831 MAJOR ALTERATIONS TOOK PLACE.THE WROUGHT IRON BALCONY RAILS WERE ADDED AND THE ATTIC STOREY,NO MORE THAN AN ORNAMENTAL PARAPET. THROUGHOUT ITS 230 YEARS EXISTENCE THE MANSION HOUSE HAS BEEN VISITED BY A LARGE NUMBER OF DISTINGUISHED VISITORS.
